reviews.text: It can be difficult travelling with a 2 year old and 5 year old, but the staff were wonderful and very accommodating. I would particularly like to thank Flora for her time , energy and understanding. The little touches (like getting cold milk for the kids to drink) made a huge difference.

Our rooms were big enough for the two kids and mum and dad to be comfortable, while Grandma and Poppa were right next door in an equally comfortable king room. Annie from housekeeping did a great job and was friendly without being 'in your face'

reviews.title: Good hotel and excellent location

reviews.text: This was a pleasant and surprising experience. I agree with what other reviewers have said about this hotel. It is well placed for various shopping malls selling luxury European goods in fashion, cosmetics and Swiss watches. It is a couple of minutes walk to two stations and about 10 minutes walk to the Star ferries. I skipped eating breakfast and just had a coffee or a tea in my room, with some fruit, or bun bought in a supermarket the day before. The hotel charges for wi-fi, but across the road in the i-square mall you can get it for free, there is also a Starbucks open until midnight. You can also get free internet at the airport and around the ferry terminal and maybe elsewhere, but it is a bit patchy. What makes this hotel stand out from the rest is the quality of the staff who are incredibly helpful and courteous. Whatever the problem, or question that I presented them with, they had an answer and solution. I had a problem with the door lock not opening, a member of the front desk team came up to look at it straight away and immediately called an engineer to fix it, which was done within a few minutes. In between I was invited to go to the bar and have a complimentary drink. Now that is service. There is a discrete security presence on the main entrances and inside the lobby. I am not sure why, but certainly on each corner walking along Nathan St, I was repeatedly asked if I wanted clothes made up by a local tailor, or to buy fake watches and while they are not aggressive, they are a constant pain. One treat I enjoyed was getting the South China Morning Post in a little black bag placed on the external door handle every morning about 7.30. I have been to other Holiday Inns in Europe and they usually quite good, but this one seemed to me as being especially good and if I found myself in the same circumstances, I would certainly go back to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Above normal standard for a Holiday Inn Hotel

reviews.text: This is a great hotel, right in the heart of the Kowloon district in Hong Kong. The rooms are very clean and come equipped with modern amenities. It is located right on Nathan Road, the main shopping street in Hong Kong. It is also with in walking distance to the harbor and the MTR, this makes it easy to get around to the rest of Hong Kong, especially Hong Kong Island. The staff is excellent and attended to any need. The breakfast buffet was good, but very expensive. If it is not included in the price of your room, I would skip it and eat at one of the many restaurants located close by. My only other fault with this hotel, is that my room had no view. It basically looked out onto an alley.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed 7 nights here and would stay here again. The location is in the heart of Tsim Tsa Tsui, just north of the harbor. You can walk all over the neighborhood, an easy 10-min walk to the Star Ferries or the MTR is basically across the street. From airport train, this hotel is on the free shuttle route from Kowloon station, so easy to get to and from airport. We appreciated the 2 bottles of water they provided daily along with an English-language newspaper. We bought juice, etc., from nice grocery in basement of i-Square mall across street and used mini-fridge to store. Gym is tiny but you can get some exercise there. Weather was too rainy/overcast/polluted to use the nice rooftop pool, but it's a nice feature.
reviews.title: Convenient location, nice property

reviews.text: The negatives include the horrid view of the dilapidated apartments across the street - very depressing. Also, EVERY single time you leave or return to the hotel, the Indian tailors and watch sellers hustle you and bother you to buy their stuff or go look at their shop. This is really annoying.

reviews.text: Breakfast wasn't included for us, but we tried the amazing breakfast buffet which was really like a brunch - including all kinds of breakfast items, Indian items, dim sum items, juices, coffees, breads, sweets, congee, etc., etc. This was fantastic, but cost about $50 for two.

reviews.text: I have recently had my third visit to this hotel and I will stand by my previous comments that their prices are on the high side although Hong Kong in general is not a cheap place to stay. The location is as others have said is great, out the door and into the MTR subway to go anywhere or walk up Nathan Rd. The street markets are a bit of a hike although but taxi’s are relatively cheap.

reviews.text: Just steps away from the exciting and bustling shopping arcades and harbour front, this hotel offers a modestly furnished (in asia standard) lobby and guest rooms (probably time to start planning a reno). I also paid for an upgrade for access to their executive lounge and late check out, which is quite worth the price if you have an evening flight. The gym is adequate but their spa facility is really uninviting (looks like an oversized closet). Staff in general are friendly, especially their bell staff. But I absolutely hate their reception area that there's no proper way for guest to line up. And some people just marched to the counter, ignoring people who have been waiting longer for the next available staff. The management really needs to look into this.

Great location
reviews.text: Its the first time for us to try Holiday Inn Golden Mile as our favorite hotels are all full booked. But I was surprised at the cleanliness of the hotel rooms. From the outside, the busy Nathan Rd. will distract you but inside, it is quiet, clean, and everything one can ask for in a hotel. Service is great. Rooms are roomy and clean, the mtr is just beside you. Malls (Isquare and K) are around you. Also, being near the Church (Mariner's Club) is also a bonus :) It is a great alternative to our favorite hong kong hotels.

Check in was nice and easy. Rooms were pretty standard for a Holiday Inn, clean, a good size space and nicely stocked. This hotel is close to shopping, food and entertainment. When I was looking out my window at around 1am I saw a large cat (lynx size) on the ledge of a neighbouring building..WTF?!?

reviews.text: This is an older style hotel. Rooms are fairly big and in comparison to the nearly KOWLOON HOTEL managed by the Peninsular, it is almost double the size! The staff are very attentive and it is sitting literally on top of the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. So location wise, it is on Nathan Road in Tsim Sha Tsui. You have shopping galore & within 10 minutes walk you are into the Ocean Terminal which is about 4 to 6 malls all linked together in air conditioned comfort. Lots of food around as well as nightlife. I stayed for about 4 nights and just found it so convenient as a base to move around. Price can vary so just make sure you do not visit Hong Kong during the peak season or when there is a "fair" in town.

reviews.title: HOLIDAY INN GOLDEN MILE

aka: Holiday Inn Golden Mile Hotel Hong Kong
description: Nestled in the very heart of Kowloon's bustling city centre lies the Holiday Inn Golden Mile , an oasis of quiet charm blending superior location, contemporary conveniences, and all the luxuries of home. The hotel is centrally located in the commercial and entertainment district of Tsim Sha Tsui, only a two-minute walk from the MTR (Hong Kong's underground Mass Transit Railway) and a forty-five minute drive from Chek Lap Kok International Airport. In addition, the famous Star Ferry and boat tour piers are also within five minutes walking distance. With invitingly comfortable guest rooms and suites, Executive Club floors, award-winning restaurants, a landscaped rooftop pool, a state-of-the-art health club, free high-speed Internet connection throughout the hotel, easy access to public transport plus shopping, dining and entertainment mere moments away - why would you stay anywhere else?
